meanings.definition: A person who works despite an ongoing strike, typically as a replacement for a striking worker.
meanings.sent1: During the strike, the company hired blacklegs to keep the business running.
meanings.sent2: The blacklegs were brought in to fill the positions left empty by the striking employees.
meanings.sent3: The blacklegs showed up for work even though they knew it wasn't right.
meanings.sent4: The presence of blacklegs in the workplace created tension among the striking workers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the blacklegs crossing the picket line stayed in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: To work as a replacement for a striking worker.
meanings.sent1: Some individuals choose to blacklegs during strikes to earn money.
meanings.sent2: He decided to blacklegs when the opportunity arose to work during the strike.
meanings.sent3: She reluctantly agreed to blacklegs for the duration of the strike.
meanings.sent4: The decision to blacklegs instead of supporting the strike was met with disapproval.
meanings.sent5: The company was desperate for workers and encouraged people to blacklegs.

meanings.sent1: The blacklegs were not welcomed by the striking workers.
meanings.sent2: He was labeled a blacklegs for taking the job during the strike.
meanings.sent3: The blacklegs were seen as betraying the solidarity of the striking workers.
meanings.sent4: Being called a blacklegs was a stain on his reputation in the community.
meanings.sent5: The presence of blacklegs prolonged the duration of the strike.
